info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 4:09PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHERN APPOMATTOX...WESTERN BUCKINGHAM AND EASTERN AMHERST COUNTIES THROUGH 500 PM EDT... At 408 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Riverville to Bent Creek to near Appomattox National Historic Park. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. Frequent cloud-to-ground lightning. Very heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rainfall may lead to flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Bent Creek... Toga... Riverville... New Glasgow... Wingina... Oakville... and Tower Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
